rawMetadata: {"compiler":{"version":"0.8.31+commit.fd3a2265"},"language":"Solidity","output":{"abi":[],"devdoc":{"details":"Library for managing uint256 to bool mapping in a compact and efficient way, provided the keys are sequential. Largely inspired by Uniswap's https://github.com/Uniswap/merkle-distributor/blob/master/contracts/MerkleDistributor.sol[merkle-distributor]. BitMaps pack 256 booleans across each bit of a single 256-bit slot of `uint256` type. Hence booleans corresponding to 256 _sequential_ indices would only consume a single slot, unlike the regular `bool` which would consume an entire slot for a single value. This results in gas savings in two ways: - Setting a zero value to non-zero only once every 256 times - Accessing the same warm slot for every 256 _sequential_
